sub_topic: The Hausdorff dimension of the Vicsek fractal.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Vicsek fractal when the number of cubes in each direction is 5?
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension of a Vicsek fractal can be calculated using the formula:

Hausdorff dimension (D) = log(N) / log(s)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and s is the scaling factor (the number of cubes in each direction).

In this case, the number of cubes in each direction is 5, so s = 5. The Vicsek fractal has 5 non-overlapping self-similar pieces (the central cube and the 4 corner cubes), so N = 5.

Now we can calculate the Hausdorff dimension:

D = log(5) / log(5)
D = 1

The Hausdorff dimension of the Vicsek fractal when the number of cubes in each direction is 5 is 1.
